result.execSummary:
The defendant Wayne A. Tullberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Wayne A. Tullberg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Wayne A. Tullberg was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Wayne A. Tullberg was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wayne A. Tullberg

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: 10:37 AM Room 301 Defendant Wayne A. Tullberg in court in custody.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Wayne A. Tullberg. State recites agreement. Def. to plead guilty - ct. 2 & ct. 3. Move ct. 1 - dismissed, but consolidated, ct. 4 - dismissed but read in. Recommends Ct. 2 - withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation, $2500 dollars, costs, Drivers license revoked lifetime, admission interlock device installed for period of 3 yrs, 75 days jail, AODA treatment recommendation, maintain absolute sobriety, banned from establishments of class B liquor license, maintain full time employment and counseling deemed necessary by agent. Ct. 3. - 60 days jail consecutive, court costs only. Def waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver. Court finds probable cause and binds case over and information filed to def atty. Def atty waives reading. Def pleads no contest to ct. 2 and ct. 3. Dismiss and consolidate ct. 1 and dismiss but read in ct. 4. Court advises defendant of constitutional rights. Court advises defendant of elements and penalties. Court warns defendant of possible deportation. Defendants atty is satisfied. Court finds defendants plea voluntarily given. Court finds factual basis. Court accepts plea. Court finds guilty of ct. 2 & ct. 3. Sentencing remarks by State. Sentencing remarks by defense. Remarks by defendant. Remarks by court. Court adopts plea agreement. Court orders on ct. 2 - withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation, fine of $2500 dollars, costs, drivers license revoked for lifetime, eligible to apply for reinstatement in 10 yrs, admission interlock device installed for period of 3 yrs, DNA unless already provided. Costs to include the $250 DNA surcharge and $50 IID fee. follow conditions of probation, 75 days jail in any county, huber privileges, AODA treatment recommendation, maintain absolute sobriety, banned from establishments of class B liquor license, seek/maintain full time employment 30 hrs per week, counseling deemed necessary by agent, AODA assessment if DL reinstated. If reinstated, complete alcohol and drug assessment according to DOT provisions and complete driver safety plan. Ct. 3. - 60 days jail consecutive to Ct. 2, huber privileges, court costs only, $200 DNA surcharge, sample unless already provided. Credit is 123 days. Court advises defendant of fire arm and voting restrictions. Court advises def post conviction rights. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Count 3 will need to be paid in full or payment plan put in place and count 2 costs to be paid during probation. (Confirmed with Judge how 123 days credit should be put on JOC.)

for bail/bond hearing
(Routed to Judge's JA)

Waiver of Prelim on September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without valid prescription,  No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, & No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

Court calls 19CM22 & 22CF136  @ 2:26 PM Defendant Wayne A. Tullberg in court, in custody from Langlade County Jail, with Atty Christopher Restemayer, via zoom.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Restemayer has copy of complaint waives reading and bond needs to be set. State filed a motion to dismiss in 19CM22 and request same bond $3,000 cash bond with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Atty Restemayer has filed bond modification and gives argument. Def. gives statement on bond.  Court gives 3 factors for setting bond and orders $2,000 cash bond Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without valid prescription,  No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, & No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Atty Restemayer waives time limits for p.h. Def. agrees to waive time limits for p.h.  Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
